name: persistently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
happening repeatedly or for a long time, or difficult to get rid of: It has been a deeply and persistently troubled region. Schools with persistently low test scores would get extra funding.
If someone does something persistently, they do it in a determined but often unreasonable way: They have persistently ignored our advice. He persistently called at her home, sent letters, and made phone calls. See
persistent
